website_summaries.verdict: The foamy cleaner clings to vertical surfaces and dissolves brake dust and grime using a unique trigger system.
pros: Easy to use – just spray on/hose off
Eats brake dust with minimal wiping
cons: May eat through clearcoat on some wheels

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars A++ RECOMMENDED breaks down the dirt and grime!!!
customer_reviews.text: 5 Stars A++ RECOMMENDED I used this on anodized rims for the SI, and I was surprised how much rust came off. We used the mitt, and the rim brush, they look like fresh new rims now, again. Easy to spray on and goes to work quick breaking down the dirt and grime, scrub lightly and rinse off. Done deal!! Meguiar’s Hot Rims Aluminum Wheel Cleaner is safe for uncoated or polished aluminum, anodized and powder coated wheels. This is the safest Meguiar’s wheel cleaner, safe for all factory coated wheels. Happy with the product, it does a nice job cleaning my rims VOTE thumbs UP IF YOU FOUND THIS HELPFUL RECOMMENDED 5 Stars A++ RECOMMENDED
customer_reviews.author: DaPoppa1

customer_reviews.title: Seems to Work Well
customer_reviews.text: I like this stuff. Used on my motorhomes polished aluminum wheels. I spray the wheels to remove loose grime, then spray with Cleaner. I wipe with microfiber towel, then rince with cool water and wipe dry. While I have only my own eyeball test and no science behind my opinion, I think the Cleaner removes some light oxidation on the aluminum, leaving a shiny reflective wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Kokomo

customer_reviews.title: Makes my aluminum wheels shine
customer_reviews.text: Used this for years on my Ford Shelby GT-500. Very easy to apply and wash off. Does a pretty good job of getting off the dirt and grime. I still have to take a microfiber cloth to get the wheels to glisten, but this gets most of the "gunk" off.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl

customer_reviews.title: Haven't used enough to rate.
customer_reviews.text: I have only tried this on one wheel. Did not seem to do much cleaning. Gave 5-star because other Meguiar products have been very good. I will try again.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Luke

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Sprays out in a thick foam and sticks to rims without running off. Only complaint is that a spray bottle doesn't last as long as expected. 5 or 6 washes and you'll need a new bottle.
customer_reviews.author: DARREN M SIDAWAY

customer_reviews.title: Does the tough jobs well
customer_reviews.text: Pricey if your wheels are really stained. Requires multiple applications but that’s because the back of the wheels haven’t been thoroughly cleaned in at least six winters.
customer_reviews.author: Gary D

customer_reviews.title: It is a great product for the cheap price
customer_reviews.text: It is a great product for the cheap price, I used almost 1/3 maybe 1/2 even of it on one use, but it does the job well enough to satisfy my expectations .
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Spray and wash off with power washer
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed how clean the rims looked. Almost like new. Just spray and then blast with the power washer
customer_reviews.author: Eddie 😎

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you get the blue bottle!
customer_reviews.text: This works a lot better than the Meguiars "Wheel and Tire" cleaner. (Not sure how you could have something that works well on metal AND rubber.) I still wind up doing a light wipe down of wheels with this cleaner. But it comes off with no effort.
customer_reviews.author: JB Finswagle

customer_reviews.title: good stuff
customer_reviews.text: works better then most, works even better combined with equal parts of the other two meguiars cleaners

customer_reviews.title: Lose the brake dust
customer_reviews.text: Good product to help remove break dust,still need a little help to fully remove but a big help

customer_reviews.title: Effective but must rinse off solution very, very well after use
customer_reviews.text: Cleans rim and alloy wheels well. BUT, be sure you rinse your wheels a number of time to remove all of the wheel cleaner. Otherwise, there can be a remaining stain on the wheels.

customer_reviews.title: Harda harda towncaaa!

customer_reviews.text: Didn't do a very good job and required a good amount of scrubbing. Regular car was soap would have done the same thing. I've used Eagle 1 before, and it was much better. Would not buy again.

customer_reviews.title: Skip This Product

customer_reviews.title: Great product!

customer_reviews.title: Cleans rim dust super easy. Its like wd40 but is like a ...
customer_reviews.text: Cleans rim dust super easy. Its like wd40 but is like a soap. Just spray and wipe with a cloth. Easy and highly recommended

customer_reviews.title: Great for your car.
customer_reviews.text: Good wheel cleaner gets the job done with no residue.

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the product, works well
customer_reviews.text: Happy with the product, it does a nice job cleaning my rims. Easy to spray on and goes to work quick breaking down the dirt and grime

customer_reviews.title: Package Handler/ Leaked
customer_reviews.text: Product is great but came leaking, less than half of liquid was empty. Other than that good reviews

customer_reviews.title: Its OK
customer_reviews.text: Its OK. I still have to scrub the wheels more then Id like. It is safe on matte finish rims but not the best for really cleaning

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use; mild foaming action with great results. Mild 'soapy' smell. Highly recommend. Usual fast shipping with Prime !!
customer_reviews.author: steveb

customer_reviews.title: Enhanced soap
customer_reviews.text: Not a big difference over soap, but it's​ a great price so I say go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cleaned my wheels well
customer_reviews.text: I got new wheels and tires from TireRack and they came some kind of gunk on them (I believe it is the lubricant they put on to make it easy to put the tire on the wheel). So I wet the wheel, sprayed this wash on, let it sit for about 15ish seconds, scrubbed it with Meguiar's wheel brush, washed it off, dried and the wheels look amazing. Note that aluminum wheel washes are the least aggressive on your wheels. Probably won't work well if you're wheels are something other than aluminum.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Lozy

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: A little too gentle....brake dust was tough to get off using just this.
customer_reviews.author: LocoLoco

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre results
customer_reviews.text: Safe for all wheels, but so weak it left a lot of the brake dust. I guess you can't have it both ways.
customer_reviews.author: Michael OBrien

customer_reviews.title: Better than tire foam...
customer_reviews.text: Lasts longer and shines better then tire foam, still does not last as long as I would like.
customer_reviews.author: Reed

customer_reviews.title: Better than car wash soap for wheels, but as aggressive as expected
customer_reviews.text: This product is better than the regular car wash... but not as strong as I expected. I guess using chemicals that are safe for paint/aluminum will only get you so far. We have really bad baked on brake break-in film (coating on brand new brakes that comes off when you first use the brakes) on some parts of the wheel. It comes off VERY slowly if I just keep scrubbing, but it's a nightmare. The Meguiar's wheel cleaner helps but it's not a silver bullet in a vampire situation if you know what I mean.
customer_reviews.author: Truth... Good, Bad, Ugly

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff for Alluminum wheels
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to get this because my wheels were charcol/black alluminum. The chemicals say they are safe and still does the job and shines good. Other cleaners I was worried about because they might erode the wheels or chip. (who knows, but better to be safe then sorry) BMW 328i 2007 Sedan, Alluminum Charcol/Black wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Mario V

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Mequiar's fan, I use their waxes and wash which do a great job but this product doesn't work at all. I used it on a 3month old car so the rims were new and it still didn't remove the brake dust. I had to rewash the rims the old fashion way, which soft brushes and car wash. Don't risk the rim damage. Don't waste your time or money.
customer_reviews.author: woofwest222

customer_reviews.title: This really cleans, still messy and requires a brush but this loosens a lot and makes it as easy as any I have used and better
customer_reviews.text: I hate wheel cleaning, takes as long as cleaning the car and 10x messier. This really cleans, still messy and requires a brush but this loosens a lot and makes it as easy as any I have used and better than most. I used one many Porsche people do, it's good but double the price of this and not better. Definite rebuy.
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: Nothing more than soap bubbles in a spray container. ...
customer_reviews.text: Nothing more than soap bubbles in a spray container. Used it on 2 sets of aluminum wheels. Would not even remove brake dust. Save your money.

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Does not clean wheels without a lot of elbow grease.

customer_reviews.title: Great product. it does a great job cleaning your ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. it does a great job cleaning your wheels without damaging your rims.

customer_reviews.title: if not I will be greatly disappointed and will update this review
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tried it yet but going on past product history of Meguiar's I'm sure it will work as advertised, if not I will be greatly disappointed and will update this review.

customer_reviews.title: disappointed with this product from Meguiar's
customer_reviews.text: I used the whole bottle for my car and it didn't clean rims I would say it take off %40 of the brakes dust .. disappointed with this product from Meguiar's .. if you want to make your rims looks a little better its good

customer_reviews.title: Rim cleaner
customer_reviews.text: This is safe for aluminum wheels, but not enough cutting power for brake residue. Barely works

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: Applied as directed and it foams up impressively but after hosing off it was obvious that I still needed a sponge and elbow grease to really get the wheels clean.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job cleaning my rims with minimum effort. Just spray and lightly brush rims, and spray rinse.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent experience with this product
customer_reviews.text: Works well on brake dust and road grime. Have used for years and haven't found anything to complain about. Rinse well.
customer_reviews.author: Lotusguy

product_meta.title: Meguiar's G14324 Hot Rims Aluminum Wheel Cleaner, 24. Fluid_Ounces
product_meta.description:
Style:Aluminum| Pattern Name:SingleMeguiar’s Hot Rims Aluminum Wheel Cleaner is engineered specifically for uncoated aluminum and other delicate materials used in many aftermarket wheels. Ultra-safe and extra gentle, Hot Rims wheel cleaner is safe on uncoated polished aluminum wheels as well as anodized and powder-coated wheel surfaces. It’s even safe on all brake components. Formulated with our Extreme Cling foam, it grabs the wheel surface to effectively and gently clean and remove brake dust and grime.

AMAZON.COM


Meguiar’s Hot Rims Aluminum Wheel Cleaner is designed to be safe on all uncoated aluminum wheels and wash away filth with ease, leaving behind clean wheels. Its unique foaming solution, Xtreme Cling is designed to cling to vertical surfaces and break down stubborn road residue from metal.

Safe for cleaning all uncoated aluminum wheels BEFORE CLEANING THE WHEELS
Know that there is a variety: The first step in wheel care is recognizing that not all wheels are made the same. Wheels are made from different types of materials and coatings. The product used on the wheels is determined by the surface which can range anywhere from chrome, powder coated, painted, to polished aluminum and many more. 

Identify what it's driving on: The next step is to determine what kind of wheels owned. Most wheels that come with a factory-purchased vehicle are clear coated wheels. However if they have been replaced with aftermarket wheels, find out the surface material by contacting the manufacturer. Some wheels may even be coated with two or three different types of coatings, depending on how customized they are. 

CHOOSING THE RIGHT WHEEL CLEANER
When using a wheel cleaner to remove brake dust and grime there are three products Meguiar’s that are available for to choose from: Meguiar’s Hot Rims Aluminum Wheel Cleaner, Meguiar’s Hot Rims All Wheel and Tire Cleaner, and Meguiar’s Hot Rims Chrome Wheel Cleaner. Meguiar’s Hot Rims Aluminum Wheel Cleaner is safe for uncoated or polished aluminum, anodized and powder coated wheels. This is the safest Meguiar’s wheel cleaner and is also recommended if you’re unable to find out what the wheel type is. This is also the best product to choose if there are any type of aftermarket or high performance brakes since they are typically made of specialized components as well. Meguiar’s Hot Rims All Wheel and Tire Cleaner is safe for all factory coated wheels. Meguiar’s Hot Rims Chrome Wheel Cleaner is specifically designed for all chrome plated wheels, and is sure to give a mirror-like finish. 

KNOWING THE CONSEQUENCES OF CHOOSING THE INCORRECT WHEEL CLEANER
Using the wrong product with the wrong surface can potentially cause permanent damage to the surface of the wheels, brake or even suspension components. Make sure to read the label on any product used and check that it is meant to work with the wheels’ surface. If unsure of the wheel type and unable to contact the manufacturer, start with the most gentle wheel cleaner and test a small area. 

APPLYING MEGUIAR’S HOT RIMS ALUMINUM WHEEL CLEANER
For best results, apply in a well-ventilated area, one wheel at a time. Not safe for motorcycle wheels or aftermarket, painted or colored brake components. 

>  * 1. Rinse wheel thoroughly with cold water.
 * 2. Coat wheels and tires with Meguiar’s Aluminum Wheel Cleaner holding bottle 6-8 inches away.
 * 3. Wait 15 seconds to allow foaming cleaners to penetrate and dissolve build-up. For heavy build-up, agitate surface with a clean microfiber wash mitt, such as Meguiar’s Microfiber Wash Mitt.
 * 4. Rinse thoroughly with water.
 * 5. Dry wheel with a 100% cotton terry cloth towel such as a Meguiar’s Soft Buff Terry Towel, or premium microfiber, such us Meguiar’s Supreme Shine Microfiber Towel.
feature_bullets: ALUMINUM WHEEL CLEANER: Meguiar’s safest, least-aggressive cleaner is designed specifically for uncoated aluminum and other sensitive materials
EFFECTIVE FOAMING ACTION: Our Extreme Cling foam grabs the wheel’s surface to effectively and gently dissolve dirt, brake-dust buildup and road grime
VERSATILE USE: Safely and effectively cleans uncoated polished aluminum, as well as alloy, anodized and powder-coated wheels
ULTRA-SAFE: Gentle cleaning agents won’t harm wheels or brake components
IDEAL FOR AFTERMARKET: The ideal choice for aftermarket wheels that often have sensitive and delicate surfaces

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars148 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
